pr_title: Support common sub-expression optimization in CursorProcessorCompiler

timeline.author: rongrong

replies.bodyText: I think this change can be removed, right?
replies.author: rongrong

timeline.bodyText: Why is this needed (handle lambda differently from before)? Ideally we'd want to reuse lambda bytecode if they are the same cross different projections. If there's any issue preventing us from doing so, we should try to fix that first.
timeline.author: rongrong

replies.bodyText: @rongrong This is actually the original implementation. It is changed to generate Lambda methods from projections and filter at once with methodName=""
replies.author: frankobe

replies.bodyText: This is not necessary. LambdaBytecodeGenerator has an API to take List<RowExpression>. In fact the API that takes a single RowExpression internally calls the other API. So we might as well change this logic to directly generate lambdas for all projections in one go. I don't think distinguishing project name is necessary. This actually might cause some missed opportunities to reuse generated lambda functions. (If two project has the same lambda, this would generate two different methods with exactly the same implementation.) So give it a try and see whether it works.
replies.author: rongrong

replies.bodyText: @rongrong Exactly, current implementation generates lambda from filter and projections in one pass. The comment is based on an outdated commit
replies.author: frankobe

timeline.bodyText:
You can just do
        List<RowExpression> rowExpressions = ImmutableList.<RowExpression>builder()
                .addAll(projections)
                .add(filter)
                .build();
timeline.author: rongrong

timeline.bodyText: What is this output? Is this supposed to be the result of the whole expression that will be written to the output page? If that's the case, I don't think the cse functions need it.
timeline.author: rongrong

timeline.bodyText: Maybe put this as a static class inside CommonSubExpressionRewritter. The class doesn't make a lot of sense standalone, especially the functions are specific to generating certain part of expression evaluation classes.
timeline.author: rongrong
rongrong

timeline.bodyText: rewriteRowExpressionsWithCSE(rowExpressions, commonSubExpressions)? You might want to rename rowExpressions to projections to be clear.
timeline.author: rongrong

timeline.bodyText: Lambda is not needed here right?
timeline.author: rongrong

timeline.bodyText: Let's call the variable METADATA to be consistent with the codebase.
timeline.author: rongrong

timeline.bodyText: All static final variables should be UPPER_CASE.
timeline.author: rongrong

replies.bodyText: I think these variables can be defined within testRewriteRowExpressionWithCSE though.
replies.author: rongrong

timeline.bodyText: Would be interesting to make the filter and projection share some cse.
timeline.author: rongrong

replies.bodyText: @rongrong mk sense. add ADD_X_Y to the projections so "X+Y" is shared between projections & filter
replies.author: frankobe

timeline.message:
Support common sub-expression optimization in CursorProcessorCompiler

Signed-off-by: frank.hu <mua08p@gmail.com>
